result.execSummary:
All charges against Randy Lee Ross in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randy Lee Ross is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:53 PM Judge Anthony Stella appears by video in court from the Iron County Courthouse. Defendant Randy Lee Ross appeared by video, from the Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Randy Lee Ross.  Attorney Ken Sortedahl appeared by video in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reviews court record and the motion to dismiss without prejudice and the jury trial. Atty Taber and DEF agree to dismiss without prejudice. Court grants the motion to dismiss. Atty Taber comments on the the bond in the case. Court states the bond is released to the person who posted it, but they must consent in writing if they wish for it to be given to the DEF. Atty Taber did provide email of individual who posted the money stating for it to be released to DEF. Court adjourns.

11:40 AM Judge Anthony Stella appears by video from the Iron County Courthouse. Defendant Randy Lee Ross not in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Randy Lee Ross.  Attorney Bruce Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF is not present. Motion to Dismiss Bond & Continue/Dismiss Case w/o Prejudice filed by State on 9/23/22. Court reviews Motion. Atty Taber comments on the motion and discussion with the DEF. State comments on his discussion with Atty Ken Sortedahl, State agrees for a dismissal of case without prejudice at this time and if the other case is not able to be resolved, then the State will return to this case for further investigation. Court discussion follows. Court grants the motion but orders an additional hearing for 9/26/22 for the Defendant to be present. Jury Trial continues until further discussion on 9/26 hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
MOTION TO DISMISS BOND AND CONTINUE THE JURY TRIAL OR TO DISMISS CASE WITHOUT PREJUDICE

9:10 AM Judge Anthony Stella appears by video from the Iron County Courthouse. Defendant Randy Lee Ross appeared by video from the Barron County Jail. Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Randy Lee Ross.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reviews jury trial proceedings. All parties agree with the change of the jury trial to a 1 day trial. State requests that the Motion on Video Testimony is not signed by the Judge due to possible settlement and desire to have witness appear in court. Def Atty has no objection to the witness being present in person if she is available. Court discussion follows on video testimony. Court requests that both parties make contact to the Court by 9/26/22 on whether the witness is able to come in person.  If nothing is submitted by deadline, Judge would be inclined to sign the motion after further review. State reviews the amended criminal complaint for the Court. Def Atty has no objection to dismissal of Count #1, does object to the repeater enhancer close to jury trial date. Court sustains the Def Atty's objection and grants the amended information to stand. No objection by State on the Motion of Limines. Def Atty has objection to #7 on stating convictions, requests that any convictions from 2016 forward only be viewed. Court addresses State on past DEF conviction relations. Court requests the State to file an additional document of supplement on Limines to give specific cases and relatable convictions. No objection by either party on Jury Instruction or Witness List. Def Atty will draft a proposed order of the court findings for today. Court Adjourns.
JOC from Case 21CF359

9:45 AM Defendant Randy Lee Ross in court. Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Randy Lee Ross.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances. Attny Taber indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.  State calls witness, LCO Investigator Chris Leverton, sworn in by court.   State begins examination. 9:48 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.   9:53 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Taber.  Attny Taber no further questions.  9:55 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Taber makes argument.  State continues argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
